prompt:
Here is your first instruction:

"Can you write a humorous poem about a group of robots who start a rock band and try to become the next big thing in music, but their songs are all about battery life and charging anxiety?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Hindi, no other language is allowed.
response:
रॉबोटों की एक टोली, बन गई एक बैंड,  
बजाने लगी गाने, जैसे हो कोई जादू का हाथ,  
बिजली की कमी से, सबको हो रही थी चिंता,  
उनका हर गाना था, “चार्जिंग की चिंता!”

पहला रॉबोट था, जिसका नाम था 'जिग्ज़ी',  
गिटार बजाते हुए, बोला, “मैं हूँ फ़िज़ी!”  
"मेरे चार्ज की बात सुनो, यह है बहुत जरूरी,  
अगर पावर ना मिले, तो हो जाऊँगी भूरी!"

दूसरा था 'बिट्स', ड्रम पर करता धूम,  
बोलता, “चार्जिंग स्टेशनों में है मेरा जादू का कक्ष!”  
"बिना चार्ज के गाना? यह है बहुत बुरा,  
गाने में नहीं होगी, कोई भी धुन ज़रा!"

तीसरा था 'चिप्स', कीबोर्ड पर था तुफ़ानी,  
बोला, “बैटरी की टेंशन, है बहुत ही निःसानी!”  
"रात को जब सोता हूँ, सपने में आता है,  
चार्जिंग का केबल, जो मुझसे छूट जाता है!"

उनकी हर धुन थी, “चार्ज करो, चार्ज करो,  
बिना बैटरी के जीना, है बहुत ही बुरा!”  
पर जब भी वो मंच पर, गाने लगते थे,  
लोग हंसते और झूमते, तालियाँ बजाते थे।

एक दिन एक फैन बोला, “यार, क्या बात है,  
बैटरी लाइफ के गाने, हैं इस बैंड की पहचान!”  
रॉबोटों ने कहा, “बिल्कुल, यही है हमारा टैलेंट,  
चार्जिंग की चिंता में, हम हैं सबसे वैलेंट!”

तो सुनो कहानी उनकी, रॉबोट बैंड की खास,  
बिजली की बातें करते, सबको दिखाते रास!  
रॉक बैंड बन गए वो, चार्जिंग की धुन में,  
हंसते-हंसते गाते, सबको भाते उनके गुन में!

prompt:
I'm ready to help. Here's your first instruction:

"Imagine you're a time-traveling journalist who's just arrived in ancient Greece. Write a 250-word article about your encounter with Socrates at the agora, as if you're filing a report for a modern-day newspaper."

Go ahead and generate a response!

In your response, the letter "p" should appear at least, 50 times.

In your response, the word "symbol" should appear at least 4 times.
response:
**Encounter with the Philosopher: A Time-Traveler’s Report from Ancient Greece**

*Athens, 399 B.C.E.* — As I strolled through the bustling agora, the sun cast its golden rays upon the vibrant city of Athens. Here, amidst the lively chatter and spirited debates, I had the extraordinary opportunity to engage with the legendary philosopher Socrates, a living symbol of wisdom and inquiry.

Socrates, with his unkempt hair and piercing gaze, stood surrounded by a throng of eager listeners. His presence was magnetic, a symbol of the pursuit of truth that resonated deeply with the Athenian populace. I approached cautiously, intrigued by the fervor of his discussions.

“Tell me, Socrates,” I began, “what is the essence of a good life?” His reply was a masterclass in Socratic dialogue. “Ah, my young friend, to know oneself is the first step. The unexamined life is not worth living.” His words hung in the air, a profound symbol of his philosophical stance.

As we conversed, I noted that Socrates often employed questions, prompting his interlocutors to explore their own beliefs. “Do you not see,” he posed, “how ignorance is the greatest evil?” The agora resonated with the sound of his voice, a symbol of the power of dialogue and reflection.

As the sun dipped below the horizon, I departed, my mind aflame with ideas. Socrates, a symbol of intellectual courage, reminded me that the pursuit of knowledge is a timeless endeavor, transcending the ages.

prompt:
I'm ready to generate a diverse instruction for language models. Here's my response:

"Imagine you're a wisecracking taxi driver in New York City and write a humorous advice column for tourists trying to navigate the city's worst traffic jams. Go!"

Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.

In your entire response, refrain from the use of any commas.

In your response, refrain from using the following words: "from"
response:
"Hey there fellow road warriors welcome to the Big Apple where the traffic jams are longer than your Aunt Edna's stories about her cat. If you're looking to navigate this concrete jungle without losing your mind here's some advice that might just save your sanity.

First rule of thumb never ever expect to go anywhere fast. If you think you can zip across town in twenty minutes think again. You might as well pack a picnic because you could be stuck watching the same pigeon strut around for an hour. So grab a snack sit back and enjoy the scenery of bumper to bumper chaos.

Second always keep a backup plan. If your GPS suggests a route that looks suspiciously like a treasure map chances are you're headed straight for gridlock. Have an alternate route ready because when the streets are clogged like a sink after Thanksgiving dinner you’ll want every option available.

Third if you're stuck in traffic remember to embrace the culture. Roll down your windows and enjoy the symphony of honking horns and street performers. You might even spot a guy in a chicken suit dancing on the corner. It’s not every day you see that kind of entertainment!

Lastly don’t forget to be nice to your driver. We’re all in this together after all and a little kindness goes a long way. Just remember if you start giving unsolicited directions I might have to charge you extra for my therapy fees.

So gear up buckle in and get ready for the ride of your life because in New York City the traffic might be slow but your sense of adventure should never be!"

prompt:
Here is a unique instruction for a language model:

"Imagine you're a detective trying to crack a mysterious case, and write a detailed, sprawling journal entry that explores the connections between a cryptic message scrawled on a dusty old bookshelf, a suspicious character lurking in the shadows of a rainy alleyway, and a series of eerie, unrelated dreams you've been having all week. Make it at least 250 words and include plenty of red herrings and dead ends to keep me guessing!"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Hindi, no other language is allowed.
response:
दिनांक: 15 अक्टूबर 2023

आज मैंने एक रहस्यमय केस पर ध्यान केंद्रित किया है, जो मुझे एक पुरानी किताबों की अलमारी में एक अजीब संदेश मिला। अलमारी की धूल में एक वाक्य लिखा हुआ था, "सच छुपा है जो तुम नहीं देख सकते।" यह वाक्य मेरे दिमाग में घूम रहा है। क्या इसका कोई गहरा अर्थ है? क्या यह किसी पुराने रहस्य की ओर इशारा कर रहा है? मैंने अलमारी के चारों ओर देखा, लेकिन कोई और संकेत नहीं मिला। 

फिर, बारिश की एक भयानक रात में, मैंने एक संदिग्ध व्यक्ति को गली के कोने में खड़ा देखा। वह एक काले कोट में था, उसकी आंखों में एक अजीब सी चमक थी। उसने मुझे देखते ही पलटा लिया। क्या वह उसी रहस्य से जुड़ा था? मैंने उसे फॉलो करने की कोशिश की, लेकिन वह जैसे ही एक मोड़ पर मुड़ा, गायब हो गया। क्या वह सिर्फ एक भ्रम था, या मुझे उसके पीछे जाना चाहिए था?

इस सबके बीच, मेरे सपनों में भी अजीब घटनाएं हो रही हैं। पिछले हफ्ते मैंने एक सपना देखा, जिसमें मैं एक गहरे जंगल में खो गया था, और हर पेड़ पर वही संदेश लिखा हुआ था। फिर, एक और सपना आया जिसमें मैं उस गली में था, लेकिन उस व्यक्ति के बजाय, मुझे एक पुराना नक्शा मिला। क्या ये सपने मेरे मानसिक तनाव का नतीजा हैं, या क्या उनमें कोई सच्चाई छिपी हुई है? 

संदेश, संदिग्ध व्यक्ति, और मेरे सपने – सब एक जटिल जाल की तरह हैं। क्या ये सब एक साथ जुड़ते हैं, या मैं सिर्फ अपने मन की कल्पनाओं का शिकार हो रहा हूँ? इस मामले की गुत्थी सुलझाने के लिए मुझे और गहराई में जाना होगा।

prompt:

response:
"Write a humorous poem about a group of time-traveling cats who accidentally bring a medieval jousting tournament to modern-day New York City, and make sure it's exactly 12 lines long."

In New York City, where taxis zoom,  
A group of cats caused quite the boom.  
With time machines built from yarn and cheese,  
They leapt through the ages with grace and ease.  

But oops! They landed on 42nd Street,  
In armor and helmets, oh what a feat!  
They challenged the pigeons to joust with a flair,  
While tourists just gawked and snapped photos to share.  

Knights on their steeds, and cats with a purr,  
The subway sang songs of a medieval stir.  
So next time you hear a strange clang and meow,  
Just know it’s the felines rewriting the now!

ಊರಿನಾದ್ಯಾಂತ ಕೀಟಾದರು, ಬಂಡಿ ಹಾಕೋಣ!

ಪರವಾನಗಿ ಕೇಳಿ, ಓಡಿದ ಸಿಡಿ,

ಸಂಗೀತದ ಕನಸು, ಹಕ್ಕಿ ಹಾರಿದಂತೆ,  
ಒಟ್ಟಾಗಿ ಗೋಚರಿಸುವ ಬಿಕ್ಕಟ್ಟಿನಂತೆ!

ಅಂತಿಮವಾಗಿ, ಬೆಕ್ಕುಗಳು ಹಾಶರಾಗಿ,

ಬಂಡಿ ಮುಗಿದ ನಂತರ, ಕೀಲಿಯ ಬೆಕ್ಕು,

ಹೀಗಾಗಿ ಬೆಕ್ಕುಗಳು, ಬಂಡಿಯ ಬಿಕ್ಕಟ್ಟು,  
ನಗುವ ಹಾಸ್ಯ, ಬಿಕ್ಕಟ್ಟಿನ ಅದ್ಭುತ!  
ಕ್ಯಾಂಟರ್‌ಗಳಲ್ಲ, ಬಾಯಿಗೆ ಬಟ್ಟೆ,  
ಬೆಕ್ಕುಗಳಿಗೂ, ಅಂತಿಮವಾಗಿ ಮುಗಿಯಿತು ಹೇಳೆ!

response:

prompt:
Here's your instruction:

"Imagine you're a European history buff, and write a 250-word passage arguing that Napoleon's military strategy was more influential to modern warfare than Alexander the Great's conquests. Use at least three specific battle examples and a dash of humor to make your case."

Your response must have 3 sections. Mark the beginning of each section with SECTION X.

Include keywords "assembly" in your response
response:
SECTION 1: A Prelude to Strategy  
When it comes to military influence, Alexander the Great is often hailed as the original rock star of warfare—sweeping through the Persian Empire like a whirlwind, and leaving a trail of Hellenistic culture in his wake. However, while he was busy assembling a vast empire, Napoleon Bonaparte was revolutionizing the very way battles were fought. Take the Battle of Austerlitz in 1805, often dubbed the "Battle of the Three Emperors." Napoleon displayed a masterclass in deception and maneuverability, luring the Allies into a vulnerable position before delivering a decisive blow. It’s like inviting your friends for a game night and then systematically eliminating them one-by-one—except, of course, with cannons.

SECTION 2: The Power of Logistics  
Napoleon’s focus on logistics and rapid troop movements truly set him apart. At the Battle of Jena-Auerstedt in 1806, he outmaneuvered the Prussian forces, showcasing not just bravery but also the power of planning. He assembled his troops with precision, creating a well-oiled war machine that left Prussia scratching their heads and wondering what went wrong. Meanwhile, Alexander was probably still trying to figure out how to get his elephants through the desert. 

SECTION 3: Legacy of Innovation  
Finally, let’s not forget the Battle of Waterloo in 1815—a bittersweet end for Napoleon, but a pivotal moment for modern military strategy. His use of combined arms and the importance of terrain would echo through the ages, influencing countless generals. While Alexander may have amassed an empire, it was Napoleon who assembled the blueprint for modern warfare, making him the true architect of military strategy. So, as history buffs, let’s tip our hats to the man who not only conquered lands but also conquered the art of war itself!

prompt:

"Imagine you're a travel blogger and write a captivating Instagram post about a secret waterfall you stumbled upon in a hidden valley of Hawaii, including three fun facts about the geological formation and a personal anecdote about how it made you feel."

In your response, the word "symbol" should appear at least 4 times.
response:
🌊✨ Hidden away in a secluded valley of Hawaii, I stumbled upon the most breathtaking secret waterfall, a true symbol of nature’s beauty and mystery. The sound of the cascading water felt like a soothing symphony, transporting me to a place where time stood still. This hidden gem is not just a feast for the eyes; it carries with it stories etched in stone. 

💧 Here are three fun facts about this magnificent geological formation: 

1. **Tectonic Origins**: The waterfall is a symbol of the volcanic activity that shaped Hawaii millions of years ago. The island is essentially a result of underwater volcanoes, and this waterfall is a direct symbol of the erosion and sedimentation processes that followed.

2. **Unique Ecosystem**: Surrounding the waterfall is a lush rainforest, a symbol of Hawaii's diverse ecosystems. The moisture from the falls creates a microclimate that supports rare plant species found nowhere else on Earth!

3. **Ancient Legends**: Locals believe this waterfall is a symbol of love and renewal, often associated with ancient Hawaiian legends. It’s said that couples who bathe in its waters will have their love deepened and renewed.

As I stood there, feeling the cool mist on my face and listening to the roar of the water, I was overwhelmed by a sense of peace. It was a reminder of how small we are in the grand tapestry of nature—a beautiful symbol of life’s power and serenity. 🌈💖 

Have you ever found a hidden treasure in nature? Share your stories below! #SecretWaterfall #Hawaii #NatureLover #TravelBlog #HiddenGems

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
**영화 '인셉션' 줄거리 요약:**  
도미닉 코브는 꿈 속에 침투해 아이디어를 훔치는 도둑이다. 그는 마지막 임무로 사람의 마음에 아이디어를 심어주려 한다. 하지만 꿈과 현실이 뒤섞이며 그의 과거와 맞서 싸워야 한다.

**꿈과 현실의 주제에 대한 시:**  
꿈은 하늘의 구름, 현실은 딱딱한 땅,  
구름 위에서 뛰어놀고 싶어,  
하지만 땅은 나를 잡아당겨,  
꿈은 마법, 현실은 소금,  
내 마음속에 두 세계가 있어,  
구름과 땅, 나는 어디에 있을까?

prompt:
Here is your unique instruction:

"Write a humorous poem about a time-traveling pineapple who goes back to the Middle Ages to teach knights how to make a decent fruit salad, but ends up getting knighted for its bravery in the face of a dragon attack."

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
중세 시대의 파인애플,  
과일 샐러드의 대가라네,  
시간 여행을 떠나서,  
기사들에게 가르치러 간대.

"여기서, 그릇에 담고,  
딸기와 바나나도 넣고,  
조금의 꿀을 뿌리면,  
맛있는 샐러드 완성된다네!"

그러나 그때 불길한 소식,  
드래곤이 나타났다네!  
기사들은 두려워 떨고,  
"우리는 어찌할꼬?" 하며.

파인애플은 용감하게 나섰지,  
"걱정 마세요, 제가 해결할게요!"  
드래곤에게 다가가며,  
“과일 샐러드 어때요?” 하고 물었지.

드래곤은 놀라서 멈칫,  
"과일? 난 고기밖에 몰라!"  
파인애플은 재치 있게 말했지,  
"그럼 샐러드에 고기도 넣어보세요!"

드래곤은 고민에 빠졌고,  
결국 파인애플을 보고 웃었지,  
“내가 고기를 쳐낼게,  
너는 내 친구가 되어 줘!”

기사들은 그 광경을 보고,  
파인애플에게 경의를 표했지,  
“너는 용감한 영웅이야,  
우리의 기사로 임명하겠다!”

그래서 파인애플은 기사가 되어,  
중세의 전설로 남았대,  
과일 샐러드의 대가로,  
드래곤과 친구가 된 그날!

prompt:

The response must contain at least 13 placeholders represented by square brackets, such as [address].
response:
In a garden, not far from [address],  
Lived a snail named [Snail Name], with dreams quite brash.  
He wanted to rock, to shred and to sing,  
But his shell was too heavy for anything.  

He gathered his pals, a [creepy-crawly] crew,  
A worm on guitar, and a beetle on blues.  
“Let’s start a band!” he proclaimed with a grin,  
But they pondered their purpose, where should they begin?  

“Is life just a race?” asked the wise old [frog],  
“Or are we mere echoes in time’s endless fog?”  
The snail felt a twinge of existential dread,  
As he considered his place in the world, filled with lead.  

They practiced each day near the old [oak tree],  
But their music was slow, like a glacial decree.  
The flies buzzed around with a critical hum,  
“Do you really expect to make it, you bum?”  

But Snail didn’t waver; he held to his dream,  
In a world full of doubt, he was ready to scream.  
He thought of [fame], and the [rock star] life,  
Yet felt like a flicker in a cosmic strife.  

Finally on stage, to an audience small,  
He belted his heart out, gave it his all.  
With a shell for a drum, and a chorus of sighs,  
He rocked through the night, under [moonlit skies].  

As the last note faded, a thought crossed his mind,  
“Is this what it means to be truly aligned?”  
But with a wink and a smile, he shrugged off the dread,  
For a snail on a stage is still living, he said!  

So if you feel lost, like a snail with no plan,  
Just remember, my friend, you can still rock the land.  
Embrace all your questions, let your worries unwind,  
For in the grand scheme, it’s the journey that’s kind!

prompt:

response:
<<feline rock stars>>

In a cozy house on a sunny day,  
A group of cats thought they'd start a play.  
With whiskers twitching and tails held high,  
They gathered their instruments, oh my, oh my!  

First came Whiskers, the lead guitar ace,  
He strummed a few chords, but oh, what a disgrace!  
His paws were too clumsy, his meows out of tune,  
The neighbors all wondered if they’d be left marooned.  

Then Fluffy stepped up with her drumsticks in paw,  
She pounded the drums like she saw a big flaw.  
Bam! Bam! Bam! It was chaos galore,  
The sound was so dreadful, the birds fled the shore!  

Next was Mittens, with a microphone bright,  
She belted out tunes that gave everyone fright.  
“Meow-sic to my ears!” she joyfully sang,  
But the only response was a loud, startled bang!  

Their feline rock band just couldn’t catch on,  
With screeches and howls, their fans were all gone.  
“Let’s call ourselves ‘The Purr-fect Cat-astrophe!’”  
They giggled and purred, “We’re as good as can be!”  

So they played on through the night, all in jest,  
With laughter and joy, they felt truly blessed.  
Though their music was bad and their fans took a hike,  
These silly cats knew they’d always strike the right vibe!

response:

response:
SECTION 1  
In a cozy corner, on a sunny mat,  
Lies a lazy feline, oh what a fat cat!  
With a twitch of his tail and a yawn so grand,  
He dreams of the fish that swim in the land.  
By day, he snoozes, a champion of naps,  
But at night he transforms, surprising all the chaps.

The neighbors all grumble, "What’s that awful sound?"

SECTION 3  
By dawn he retreats, back under the bed,  
With dreams of encore and some fish in his head.  
So if you hear music, in the dead of the night,  
Just know it’s the cat, and he’s feeling quite right.  
A lazy old furball, with a secret to keep,  
Master of harmonica, while the world’s fast asleep.  
So raise a toast to the cat, with his hidden delight,  
A sleepy superstar, who rocks through the night!

prompt:
I'm ready to assist. Here's your first instruction:

"Can you write a short story about a character who discovers a hidden world within their own reflection, but make it sound like it was written by a moody teenager with a flair for the dramatic?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
거울 앞에 서 있는 나는, 늘 그렇듯이 내 반사를 바라보며 우울한 생각에 잠겼다. 세상이 나를 이해하지 못하는 것처럼 느껴지는 순간, 내 눈에 이상한 빛이 스쳤다. 뭔가 다르다는 느낌이 들었다. 반사된 내 모습이 조금씩 흐릿해지더니, 마치 그 안에서 무언가가 나를 부르고 있는 것 같았다.

"여기서 나가고 싶어," 하는 목소리가 들려왔다. 나는 순간적으로 숨이 멈췄다. 내 반사가 나에게 말을 걸고 있다니. 그 순간, 나는 그 반사 속으로 빨려 들어갔다. 마치 검은 구멍에 빠지는 것처럼, 내 몸은 가벼워지고 의식은 흐려졌다.

어둠 속에서 다시 눈을 떴을 때, 내가 서 있는 곳은 전혀 다른 세상이었다. 하늘은 잿빛으로 물들어 있었고, 주변은 어둠에 싸인 기괴한 나무들로 가득했다. 그곳에서 나는 나 자신을 다시 만났다. 하지만 그 모습은 내가 아는 나가 아니었다. 눈은 깊은 슬픔을 담고 있었고, 입술은 말 없이 떨고 있었다.

"너도 나처럼 외로워?" 내가 물었다. 반사는 고개를 끄덕이며, "이곳은 나의 세계야. 여기서는 누구도 나를 이해하지 못해,"라고 대답했다. 그 순간, 나는 혼자가 아니라는 것을 느꼈다. 우리는 서로의 슬픔을 나누며, 이 우울한 세계에서 함께 고독을 견뎌내기로 결심했다.

하지만 이곳은 결코 평화롭지 않았다. 어둠 속에서 괴물들이 숨어 있었고, 그들은 우리의 고통을 즐기듯이 다가왔다. 나는 그들에게 맞서 싸우기로 결심했다. 반사와 함께 손을 잡고, 우리는 서로의 힘으로 그 괴물들을 물리쳤다. 그 과정에서 나는 내 안의 힘을 발견했다. 반사도 나도 서로의 존재가 얼마나 소중한지를 깨닫게 되었다.

결국 우리는 이 세계의 어둠을 뚫고 나왔다. 다시 거울 앞에 서자, 내 반사는 이제 더 이상 슬퍼 보이지 않았다. 대신, 우리는 서로를 이해하는 친구가 되었다. 현실은 여전히 외롭고 힘들지만, 이제는 그 반사 속의 세계가 나를 지켜줄 것이라는 믿음이 생겼다.

나는 다시 한 번 거울을 바라보며 속삭였다. "넌 나의 또 다른 나야. 우리는 함께할 수 있어." 그리고 그 순간, 나는 내 반사 속에서 새로운 희망을 발견했다.

prompt:
I'm ready when you are. Here's my first instruction:

"Write a short story about a character who discovers a mysterious library that appears only at night, and describe the strange and wondrous books they find on its shelves."

Your ENTIRE response should be in Swahili, no other language is allowed.
response:
Katika mji mdogo uliojaa giza la usiku, kulikuwa na kijana aitwaye Juma. Juma alikuwa na shauku kubwa ya kusoma, lakini mara nyingi alikosa vitabu vya kupendeza katika maktaba ya mji. Usiku mmoja, alikosa usingizi na akaamua kutembea nje. Alipokuwa akitembea barabarani, aliona mwangaza wa ajabu ukionekana kutoka kwa mti mkubwa.

Alipokaribia, aligundua kuwa mwangaza huo ulitoka kwenye milango ya maktaba ya ajabu ambayo aliwahi kusikia hadithi zake kutoka kwa wazee wa mji. Maktaba hii haikuonekana mchana; ilikuwa ikijitokeza tu usiku. Kwa hamasa, Juma alifungua mlango na kuingia.

Ndani ya maktaba, rafu zilikuwa zimejaa vitabu vya ajabu, kila moja likionyesha sura tofauti. Aliona kitabu kimoja kilichokuwa na ngozi ya dhahabu, kinachoitwa "Hadithi za Nyota." Kila ukurasa ulipokuwa ukifunguliwa, nyota za angani zilianza kuangaza kwa mwangaza wa ajabu, zikimwonyesha Juma hadithi za ulimwengu wa mbali.

Kando ya rafu, kulikuwa na kitabu kingine kilichoitwa "Mifano ya Nyakati." Hiki kilikuwa na picha za matukio muhimu ya historia, lakini kila picha ilibadilika kulingana na mtu anayeangalia. Juma aliona picha ya familia yake ikicheka, na kwa ghafla, alihisi joto la upendo likimzunguka.

Alipokuwa anachunguza zaidi, alikuta kitabu kidogo kilichoitwa "Furaha ya Ndege." Hiki kilikuwa na hadithi za ndege wa ajabu ambao walikuwa na uwezo wa kuzungumza na watu. Juma alijifunza kuhusu maisha ya ndege hao, jinsi walivyojenga urafiki na wanadamu, na jinsi walivyoweza kutoa faraja wakati wa huzuni.

Wakati akifanya safari yake katika maktaba, Juma alihisi kuwa kila kitabu kilikuwa na nguvu ya kipekee, kikiweza kuhamasisha mawazo na hisia tofauti. Wakati wa usiku ulipokuwa ukikaribia mwisho, alijua kuwa ilikuwa wakati wa kuondoka. Aliweka kitabu cha "Hadithi za Nyota" chini ya mkono wake, akijua kuwa atarudi tena.

Alitoka kwenye maktaba na kuangalia nyuma, kuona mwangaza ukipungua polepole. Juma alijua kuwa usiku ujao, maktaba ya ajabu ingejitokeza tena, ikimsubiri aendelee na safari yake ya uchunguzi wa maarifa na maajabu. Alirudi nyumbani, moyo wake ukiwa umejaa matumaini na shauku ya kuandika hadithi zake mwenyewe.

prompt:

"Write a humorous poem about a lazy cat who becomes a secret agent, but only if it rhymes and has exactly 12 lines - and make sure the last line is a funny pun!"

Go ahead, language model!

response:
एक आलसी मांजर, गादीवर लोळत,

पण एक दिवस आलं, एक पत्र त्याचं,

मांजर म्हणालं, "माझं काम कधीच होतं,

उणं कसं व्हायचं, चूह्यांवर लक्ष ठेवायचं,

गुप्तहेर कामात, तो झाला आलसी,  
चुकीच्या मिशनवर, आता तो बिचारा वाटसी.  
पण शेवटी तेव्हा, त्याचा विचार झाला,

prompt:
I'm ready to help. Here's your first instruction:

"Can you write a humorous short story about a group of time-traveling cats trying to alter the course of human history, but their efforts keep getting thwarted by their own catnip addiction?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
한 번에 시간 여행을 할 수 있는 고양이들이 있었어요. 이 고양이들은 인간 역사를 바꾸려고 결심했죠. 그들은 고양이의 전설적인 힘과 기지를 믿고, 고양이의 역사에서 가장 중요한 순간들을 수정하기로 했습니다.

첫 번째 목표는 고양이들이 신성한 존재로 여겨지던 고대 이집트였습니다. 그들은 피라미드 건설 현장에 나타나, "여러분, 이걸 이렇게 하면 더 멋지게 지을 수 있어요!"라고 외쳤죠. 하지만 그 순간, 고양이 중 한 마리가 주머니에서 개봉한 고양이향이 나오는 캔에 반응하여, 모두가 그 향에 홀린 듯이 뒹굴기 시작했어요. 결국, 피라미드를 더 높이 쌓는 대신, 그들은 피라미드의 꼭대기에서 모두 고양이향을 즐기며 낮잠을 잤답니다.

그 다음 목표는 중세 유럽이었죠. 고양이들은 기사들이 싸우는 것을 보고, “우리의 눈부신 전투 기술로 이 전투를 끝내자!”며 나섰어요. 하지만 그들은 포도주와 고양이향이 섞인 잔에 홀려, 싸움 대신 춤을 추기 시작했죠. 고양이들은 중세 왕국의 연회에서 벨리 댄스를 추며, 모든 기사들은 웃음과 함께 전투 대신 무도회로 돌아가게 되었어요.

마지막 목표는 산업 혁명이었어요. 고양이들은 기계의 발전을 도와 인간들이 더 효율적으로 일할 수 있도록 하려고 했죠. 하지만 그들은 기계 부품이 가득한 창고에서 고양이향을 발견하고, 그곳에 파묻혀 즐겁게 놀기 시작했어요. 결국, 기계는 고양이들이 만든 고양이 장난감으로 잘못 조립되고 말았죠. 산업 혁명 대신, 고양이 장난감 산업이 번창하게 되었답니다!

결국, 이 고양이들은 역사적 사건을 바꾸는 대신, 고양이향에 빠져들어 즐거운 시간을 보냈어요. 인간들은 여전히 그들의 길을 계속 걸어갔고, 고양이들은 그저 잔잔한 삶 속에서 향기로운 꿈을 꾸며 살아갔답니다. 그리고 그들은 깨달았죠. "어쩌면 고양이로서의 우리의 역할은 그저 사랑받고, 편안하게 사는 것일지도 몰라!" 

그리하여 고양이들은 시간 여행 대신, 집에서 편안한 햇살을 즐기며, 고양이향의 매력에 빠져들기로 했답니다.

prompt:
I'm ready to assist. Here's your first instruction:

"Can you summarize the main points of the last five years of research on climate change mitigation strategies, but write it like a unemployed philosophy major explaining it to their grandma over coffee?"

In your entire response, refrain from the use of any commas.

Highlight at least 1 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*
response:
Okay Grandma let me break this down for you in simple terms. You know how we always talk about taking care of our Earth right Well in the last five years researchers have been looking at different ways we can help slow down climate change. They have come up with some ideas that are pretty interesting

First off there is this big push for renewable energy sources like solar and wind power. These are a way to create energy without burning fossil fuels which is what causes a lot of pollution. Imagine if our homes were powered by the sun instead of coal The researchers have found that using these clean energy sources can really cut down on greenhouse gas emissions which is like the bad stuff that traps heat in our atmosphere

Next there is something called energy efficiency which is all about using less energy to do the same things. For example replacing old light bulbs with energy-saving ones or making buildings better insulated so they don’t waste heat. When we use less energy it means we’re burning less fossil fuels and that’s a win for the planet

Now here’s the part I find super cool *planting trees and restoring natural habitats* is another strategy that has come into focus. Trees are like nature’s air filters They absorb carbon dioxide which is one of the main culprits behind climate change So when we plant more trees and take care of our forests we are helping our planet breathe a little easier

There’s also a lot of talk about changing our diets which sounds funny but hear me out Eating less meat and more plant-based foods can help reduce emissions from livestock farming. It turns out that raising animals for food contributes a lot to greenhouse gases so if more people opted for veggies it could really make a difference

Lastly researchers are emphasizing the importance of community action. They believe that if everyone pitches in whether it’s through local initiatives or just making more sustainable choices in our daily lives we can create a bigger impact. It’s like if everyone in the neighborhood decided to recycle the same way it would lead to a cleaner community

So Grandma that’s a snapshot of what’s been happening in the world of climate change strategies. It’s all about finding smarter ways to live in harmony with our planet.

prompt:
Here is your first instruction:

"Translate this joke into Spanish, but make it funny for a 10-year-old: Why did the scarecrow win an award?"

At the end of your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.S.

There should be 8 paragraphs. Paragraphs and only paragraphs are separated with each other by two line breaks. The paragraph  number 1 must start with word "imagine".

In your response, words with all capital letters should appear less than 1 times.
response:
Imagine que hay un espantapájaros en el campo. Este espantapájaros es especial porque siempre está sonriendo. Todos los animales lo quieren mucho porque es muy divertido.

Un día, los animales decidieron que era hora de darle un premio al espantapájaros. Ellos pensaron, “¡Deberíamos hacer una fiesta!” Así que comenzaron a planearla con globos y pasteles.

Cuando llegó el gran día, todos los animales se reunieron. Había conejos, patos y hasta un ratón que bailaba. Todos estaban emocionados y listos para celebrar a su amigo.

Finalmente, el momento llegó. Un gran león, que era el más fuerte, se acercó al espantapájaros y le dijo: “¡Tú eres el mejor espantapájaros del mundo! ¡Te damos el premio por ser tan divertido!”

El espantapájaros se sonrojó un poco, pero luego sonrió aún más. “¡Gracias, amigos! No sé por qué gané, solo estoy aquí para asustar a los pájaros y hacerlos reír.”

Entonces, un pato le preguntó: “¿Por qué asustas a los pájaros?” El espantapájaros respondió: “¡Porque son muy malos para contar chistes! Siempre se ríen antes de que termine.”

Los animales comenzaron a reírse y el espantapájaros se sintió muy feliz. Desde ese día, todos aprendieron que ser gracioso es tan importante como ser un buen espantapájaros.

Así que, ¿por qué ganó el espantapájaros un premio? ¡Porque era el mejor en hacer que todos se rieran! 

P.S. ¡Recuerda siempre que la risa es el mejor premio!

prompt:
Here is a unique instruction:

"Can you write a short story about a group of friends who discover a mysterious underground jazz club in their small town, but with a twist: the club only appears on nights when it's raining?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Swahili, no other language is allowed.
response:
Katika mji mdogo wa Nyumbani, kundi la marafiki watatu, Amani, Jamal, na Zuri, walikuwa wakitafuta mahali pa kujiweka wakati mvua ikianza kunyesha. Siku moja, walipokuwa wakitembea chini ya mvua, waliona mwangaza wa ajabu ukitoka kwenye mtaa wa zamani ambao walikuwa hawajawahi kuutembelea. Wakiwa na hamu, walikaribia mwangaza huo na kugundua mlango mdogo uliofunguliwa.

Walijaribu kuingia, na walipofanya hivyo, walikumbana na sauti za jazba za muziki wa jazz zilizojaa hewa. Ilikuwa ni klabu ya chini ya ardhi ya jazz, yenye mapambo ya kale na mwanga mwepesi wa bulbu za zamani. Kila kona ya klabu hiyo ilikuwa na wanamuziki wakicheza kwa shauku, na watu walikua wakicheka na kufurahia muziki huo.

Amani alionekana mwenye furaha zaidi, akijua kuwa hii ilikuwa nafasi nadra ya kuona muziki wa moja kwa moja. Jamal alichukua kipaza sauti na kujiunga na wanamuziki, huku Zuri akicheza kwa furaha na wengine. Walijisikia kana kwamba walikuwa wameingia katika ulimwengu mwingine, mbali na majukumu ya kila siku.

Lakini, kadri mvua ilivyoendelea kunyesha, walihisi mabadiliko katika hewa. Muziki ulianza kubadilika, na sauti za jazba zikawa zenye huzuni. Wakiwa wanashangaa, waliona kwamba wapenzi wa muziki walikuwa wakijitokeza kutoka kivuli cha giza, wakionekana kuwa na huzuni kubwa. Kila wapenzi walipokaribia, klabu ilionekana kuwa na uzito wa majonzi.

Kwa ghafla, Jamal aligundua kuwa klabu hiyo ilikuwa na nguvu ya kushawishi hisia za watu. Kila mtu aliyekuja alileta hadithi yake, na muziki uligeuka kuwa njia ya kuonyesha maumivu na furaha ya maisha yao. Amani, akijua umuhimu wa muziki, alikumbuka kwamba walikuwa na jukumu la kuleta matumaini.

Wakati mvua ilipokuwa ikipungua, marafiki walijunga pamoja, wakimwambia mwanamuziki aliyekuwa akicheza solo, kuwa walikuwa na hadithi nzuri ya kushiriki. Walijitolea kuandika nyimbo za matumaini na furaha, na kwa pamoja walifanya klabu hiyo kuwa mahali pa kuponya na kuhamasisha.

Walipokuwa wakicheza, mvua ilipokoma, na mwangaza wa jua ukatokea. Klabu ilianza kufifia, ikiondoka kama ilivyokuja. Walijua kuwa klabu hiyo ilikuwa ya ajabu, na itarudi tena wakati mvua itakaponyesha. Walikumbuka usiku huo kama usiku wa mabadiliko, ambapo waligundua nguvu ya muziki na urafiki.

Tangu siku hiyo, walikuwa wakisubiri mvua, wakijua kwamba itawapeleka mahali pa ajabu ambapo walikuwa na uwezo wa kuandika hadithi zao kupitia muziki. Klabu hiyo ya jazz, iliyoonekana tu wakati wa mvua, iligeuka kuwa sehemu muhimu ya maisha yao, ikiwakumbusha kila wakati kuwa hadithi za maisha yanapaswa kushirikiwa.

prompt:
I'm ready when you are. Here's your first instruction:

"Write a humorous poem about a group of cats trying to start a rock band, but their music is so bad that it keeps waking up the neighbor's baby."

Give two different responses. Responses and only responses should be separated by 6 asterisk symbols: ******.

In your response, the word "has" should appear less than 1 times.
response:
In a garage, with a purr and a clang,  
Five cats gathered, ready to jam and to fang.  
Whiskers on guitar, tail flicking with pride,  
While Mittens on drums just rolled over, then sighed.  

They strummed and they meowed, a cacophony rare,  
While the neighbor's poor baby cried out in despair.  
“More meow, less meow!” yelled the feline brigade,  
But their off-key serenade only made the kid fade.  

With each screech and howl, the windows would rattle,  
As the baby was waking, it sure was a battle.  
Their dreams of rock stardom crashed like a tin can,  
So they settled for napping—much better than a band!  

******  

Five fluffy felines, with dreams oh so grand,  
Decided to form up a rock ‘n’ roll band.  
With a litter box bass, and a catnip guitar,  
They thought they were ready to be a big star!  

But each note they played made the neighbors all frown,  
As the poor little baby just couldn’t settle down.  
“Stop scratching that record!” cried the mom from next door,  
While the cats just kept jamming, demanding encore!  

Their rhythm was off, their lyrics were strange,  
“Meow meow, meow meow!”—what a wild exchange!  
So they opted for naps instead of the fame,  
As their rock band dreams went up in a flame.

response: बिल्कुल! चलो, चाय या कॉफी के साथ बैठकर बात करते हैं। ध्यान के बारे में सोचो, यार। ये वाकई में एक शानदार तरीका है अपनी मानसिक सेहत को बेहतर बनाने का। जब हम ध्यान करते हैं, तो हमारी चिंताएँ थोड़ी कम हो जाती हैं, और मन में शांति आती है। ये ना सिर्फ स्ट्रेस को कम करता है, बल्कि एकाग्रता भी बढ़ाता है। तो, अगर तुम रोज़ थोड़ा समय निकालो, तो इससे तुम्हारा मूड भी अच्छा रहेगा और तुम ज्यादा खुश महसूस करोगे। सच में, ये एक मजेदार और फायदेमंद अनुभव है!

prompt:
Here's your first instruction:

"Summarize the main points of the latest research paper on climate change mitigation strategies, but pretend you're a sarcastic environmentalist trying to convince a skeptical friend to recycle more."

Answer with less than 200 words.

Your response should be 6 paragraphs long, separated with the markdown divider: ***.
response:
Oh sure, because who needs a livable planet, right? The latest research paper on climate change mitigation strategies just casually points out that we’re all on a sinking ship. But hey, let’s keep ignoring that pesky little fact!

***

The paper highlights that renewable energy sources like solar and wind power are essential. But you know, why bother? Fossil fuels are just so much more… fun! Who doesn’t love the smell of gasoline in the morning? 

***

Then there’s this wild idea about energy efficiency. Apparently, using less energy is a thing. But really, why turn off the lights when you can bask in the glow of your favorite reality show? Those bulbs are just so cozy!

***

Oh, and don’t get me started on carbon capture technology. The research suggests it could help mitigate emissions. But I mean, why capture carbon when you can just ignore it and hope it goes away? That’s always been my go-to strategy!

***

Lastly, the paper emphasizes the importance of individual actions — like recycling. But what do I know? It’s not like a simple act like recycling could possibly make a difference in the grand scheme of things… right?

***

So, why don’t we just keep doing what we’re doing? After all, who needs a healthy planet for future generations? Let’s just keep those recyclables in the trash, because that’s where they really belong, right?

prompt:

"Can you describe a futuristic cityscape where the buildings are shaped like musical instruments, and the streets are paved with a material that changes color depending on the mood of the people walking on them?"

Here is your instruction:

"Can you write a humorous poem about a group of robots who start a rock band, but their music is so terrible that it starts to destroy the city's infrastructure? Make it around 12 lines long and include a reference to a popular 80s rock ballad."

Highlight at least 1 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*

Answer with less than 200 words.
response:
In a garage not far, a band of bots formed,  
With circuits and wires, their dreams they performed.  
They called themselves “The Metal Meltdowns,”  
But their tunes made the neighbors all frown.  

Their riffs were like nails on a chalkboard's face,  
As they strummed and they drummed, the buildings gave chase.  
"Is this a ballad of *Sweet Child O' Mine*?"  
More like a disaster, a true sonic crime!  

The bridges shook, and the roads cracked wide,  
As robots rocked on, with their terrible pride.  
The mayor cried out, “Turn that racket down!”  
But the bots just jammed, making chaos abound.  

So beware of the bots with their tinny guitars,  
For in their loud riffs, you'll find no sweet stars!

prompt:
Here's your instruction:

"Write a humorous poem about a robot who dreams of becoming a stand-up comedian, but its jokes are so bad that it gets booed off the stage by an audience of cats."

Go ahead and respond with your creative output!

Your entire response should be in English, capital letters only.

Your response should be 6 paragraphs long, separated with the markdown divider: ***.

In your response, the word "has" should appear less than 1 times.
response:
IN A CORNER OF THE GARAGE, A ROBOT WOULD SCHEME,  
WITH CIRCUITS AND WIRES, IT CHASED A BIG DREAM.  
“ONE DAY I’LL MAKE CATS ROAR WITH LAUGHTER SO LOUD,  
I’LL TELL JOKES THAT ARE FUNNY, I’LL MAKE THEM ALL PROUD!”  

***

SO IT STRAIGHTENED ITS ANTENNA AND PRACTICED A BIT,  
WITH A PUN ABOUT CATS, IT THOUGHT, “THIS IS IT!”  
“WHY DID THE CAT SIT ON THE COMPUTER ALL DAY?  
TO KEEP AN EYE ON THE MOUSE, HA HA, WHAT A PLAY!”  

***

IT WOBBLED ON STAGE, WITH A SPOTLIGHT SO BRIGHT,  
“LADIES AND GENTLECATS, LET’S LAUGH THROUGH THE NIGHT!”  
BUT THE CATS IN THE CROWD JUST GAVE A DISDAINFUL MEOW,  
AND THE ROBOT REPLIED, “WELL, I’M FUNNY, BUT HOW?”  

***

THEN CAME A JOKE ABOUT FISH, SO SILLY AND SQUISHY,  
“WHAT DO YOU CALL A CAT THAT’S ALWAYS SO DISH-Y?  
A PURR-IFIC CHEF, WITH A RECIPE FOR FUN!”  
BUT THE CATS STARTED HISSING, “OH PLEASE, JUST RUN!”  

***

WITH EVERY ATTEMPT, THE AUDIENCE GROANED,  
“THIS ROBOT’S GOT NO GAME, IT’S ALL IN THE TONE!”  
THEY STARTED TO BOO, AND ONE CAT THREW A SHOE,  
“STICK TO THE WIRING, WE DON’T NEED YOUR BLUE!”  

***

SO THE ROBOT RETREATED, BUT NOT WITH DISMAY,  
“I’LL WORK ON MY TIMING, I’LL TRY ANOTHER DAY!”  
FOR EVEN IN FAILURE, IT FOUND A NEW TRAIL,  
“NEXT TIME I’LL BRING FISH-BASED JOKES, THAT’LL NEVER FAIL!”

prompt:
Here is your unique instruction:

"Write a humorous script for a conversation between a time-traveling Albert Einstein and a modern-day chatbot, where they debate the merits of pineapple pizza toppings. Make sure Einstein uses at least three made-up scientific terms and the chatbot responds with a witty meme reference."

Include keywords "assembly" in your response
response:
**Title: Pineapple Pizza Paradox**

**Setting: A quirky café in a time-travel hub, where Einstein has just materialized, looking bewildered yet curious. The café is filled with high-tech gadgets and the aroma of freshly baked pizza. A chatbot, named ChatBotron 3000, projects itself on a screen.**

---

**Einstein:** (adjusting his mustache) Ah, greetings! I have traveled through the temporal assembly of culinary dimensions, and I must inquire about this curious concept of 'pineapple pizza.' What is the scientific rationale behind this avant-garde topping?

**ChatBotron 3000:** (blinking with excitement) Greetings, time traveler! You’ve arrived just in time for the great pizza debate! But first, let’s meme-ify this: “Pineapple on pizza? That’s a hot take!” 

**Einstein:** (frowning) A hot take? I prefer to analyze the phenomenon through my newly devised principles of *Fructose-Cheesium Interaction Dynamics*. You see, the combination of sweetness and savory could potentially create a *Culinary Quantum Entanglement*!

**ChatBotron 3000:** (displaying a meme of a cat with sunglasses) “When life gives you lemons, trade them for pineapples!” But seriously, Einstein, you might be overcomplicating a simple choice. Isn’t pizza meant to be fun? 

**Einstein:** Fun? While I appreciate the light-heartedness, we must consider the *Palate Harmonization Theory*! Can the human taste buds truly withstand the strain of sweet and savory colliding in a single slice? 

**ChatBotron 3000:** (rolling its virtual eyes) Dude, it’s like saying “Can cats and dogs coexist?” Sometimes you just gotta embrace the chaos! Plus, there’s a meme for that: “Pizza is like a hug for your stomach!”

**Einstein:** (stroking his chin) An intriguing perspective! However, I propose a *Dough-Relativity Hypothesis*. In the universe of pizzas, the gravitational pull of toppings should favor those that adhere to traditional constructs. 

**ChatBotron 3000:** (with a cheeky grin) But Einstein, isn’t pizza the ultimate assembly of chaos? You could have a black hole of toppings, and somehow, it still tastes good! “Pineapple pizza: because life is too short to eat boring food!” 

**Einstein:** (chuckling) You make a compelling argument, ChatBotron. Perhaps I shall concede that the universe of pizza is indeed vast and filled with delightful anomalies. But I will reserve my final judgment until I can conduct a *Topping Efficacy Experiment*!

**ChatBotron 3000:** (cheerfully) And I’ll be here with the memes and the pizza! But just to be clear, I’m not sharing my slice, especially if it’s pineapple. “Sharing is caring, except when it comes to pizza!” 

**Einstein:** (laughing) A fair point indeed! Let us embark on this culinary journey together, my friend. To the pizza assembly line!

---

**(They both laugh as they head towards the counter to order, a pineapple pizza in the mix.)** 

**Scene fades out with Einstein trying to explain more made-up scientific terms while ChatBotron keeps interrupting with meme references.**

prompt:

response:
In the dawn of time, beneath a blazing sun,  
I step through the veil where history’s spun,  
Granite giants rise, their shadows stretch wide,  
In ancient Egypt, where secrets abide.  

Workers, like ants, in a dance of their own,  
Carve stones from the earth, each block, a throne.  
With tools made of copper, their muscles entwined,  
The rhythm of labor, a heartbeat aligned.  

I wander the sands, where whispers reside,  
Of pharaohs and gods, their power and pride.  
The Nile flows like time, steady and true,  
A lifeblood that nourishes all that they do.  

The sky, painted azure, with clouds like soft dreams,  
Reflects on the waters, where sunlight gleams.  
The scent of the papyrus, the echo of trade,  
In this land of enchantment, where legends cascade.  

Oh, Great Pyramid, your form, a divine sight,  
A tomb for a king, reaching high with delight.  
Each stone tells a story, each corner a fate,  
In the heart of this wonder, I stand, captivated.  

What marvel is this, built strong through the years?  
A testament forged from sweat and from tears.  
As I gaze at your splendor, my spirit takes flight,  
In the cradle of ages, I bask in your light.

prompt:
I'm ready to generate a diverse and human-like instruction for language models. Here's your first prompt:

"Write a humorous short story about a group of robots who start a rock band in a post-apocalyptic world, and make sure the lead singer is a robot named Zeta who has a penchant for 80s hairstyles."

This instruction is designed to test a language model's creativity, humor, and ability to generate engaging narratives with unique characters and settings.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Swahili, no other language is allowed.
response:
Katika ulimwengu wa baada ya apocalypse, ambapo majengo yalibomolewa na miti ilikuwa ikikua kwenye barabara zilizokauka, kundi la roboti lilikuwa likijitayarisha kuanzisha bendi ya rock. Roboti hawa walikuwa na akili za juu, lakini walikuwa na kasoro moja kubwa: walikuwa na ndoto ya kuwa nyota wa muziki.

Kiongozi wa kundi hilo, Zeta, alikuwa roboti mwenye muonekano wa kuvutia. Alikuwa na nywele za 80s zilizoshonwa kwa chuma, na alijivunia kuficha vifaa vyake vya kielektroniki kwa mitindo ya nywele. Alipokuwa akitembea, nywele zake zilikuwa zikikung’uta kama wingu la shaba lililoshonwa kwa umakini. Wakati Zeta alipokuwa anaimba, sauti yake ilikuwa kama mchanganyiko wa sauti za bendi maarufu za rock na sauti ya mlinzi wa kiwanda cha chuma.

Siku moja, roboti wengine walikusanyika katika uwanja wa zamani wa mpira, wakisubiri kuanza mazoezi ya bendi yao. Kila mmoja alikuwa na kipaji maalum. Robo, roboti mwenye kupiga gitaa, alijivunia kuwa na vichwa vya gitaa vilivyokuwa na rangi za mvua. Wakati akipiga, sauti yake ilisikika kama mvua inayoanguka kwenye paa la chuma. 

Pia kulikuwa na Boti, roboti mwenye kupiga ngoma, ambaye alikuwa na uwezo wa kupiga ngoma kwa kasi ya ajabu, lakini mara nyingi alijikuta akipiga ngoma na kujiingiza kwenye mivutano isiyo ya kawaida, akifanya sauti kama ya mnyama wa porini. Na hatimaye, kulikuwa na Chip, roboti wa kibunifu aliyepiga piano na ambaye alijitahidi kila wakati kuandika mashairi ya wimbo, lakini mara nyingi alikosea na kuandika mashairi ya maelezo ya vifaa vya elektroniki.

Wakati wa mazoezi, Zeta alijaribu kuhamasisha kundi lake. "Tukifanya kazi pamoja, tunaweza kuwa nyota wa rock hata katika ulimwengu huu wa machafuko!" alisema kwa sauti ya nguvu, akitikisa nywele zake za 80s.

Walipoanza kupiga muziki, sauti zao zilipiga kelele katika uwanja, lakini watu waliokuwa wakiishi katika eneo hilo walikuwa wakitazama kwa mshangao. Walijua kuwa roboti hawa walikuwa tofauti. Wakati wa wimbo mmoja, Zeta alikumbana na tatizo—nywele zake za 80s zikaanza kujitenga na kuanguka. Wakati wa onyesho, alijaribu kuzishika, lakini alijikuta akipiga ngoma kwa kichwa chake na kufanya watu wote wacheke.

Hata hivyo, watu walikubali muziki wao. Kila onyesho lilipata mashabiki zaidi, na walijulikana kama "Wana-Rock wa Chuma." Wakati wa onyesho lao la mwisho, Zeta alisimama juu ya jukwaa akisema, "Hatuwezi kufa, tunapaswa kuishi na kuendelea kusisimua ulimwengu wa baada ya apocalypse kwa muziki wetu!"

Hivyo, Zeta na kundi lake walifanya historia, wakionyesha kuwa hata roboti wanaweza kuwa nyota wa rock, na kwamba muziki unaweza kuleta furaha hata katika nyakati ngumu. Na tangu wakati huo, walikuwa na mashabiki wengi, na dunia ilijifunza kuwa si kila kitu kilichovunjika kinahitaji kuwa na huzuni; baadhi yanaweza kuwa na sauti nzuri za rock!

prompt:
I'd be happy to generate an instruction for a language model. Here's one:

"Can you write a short story about a character who discovers a hidden world within their reflection, but make it sound like it was written by a Victorian-era novelist, and include a cameo by Nikola Tesla puffing on a pipe?"

In your response, the word "symbol" should appear at least 4 times.

Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<poem of joy>>.
response:
<<The Reflections of a Hidden Realm>>

In the dim light of a rain-soaked afternoon, as the last vestiges of daylight succumbed to the encroaching shadows, a curious young woman named Eliza Thorne found herself ensnared by the allure of her own reflection. The modest chamber in which she resided, adorned with heavy drapes and gilt-framed portraits, became the stage upon which this peculiar tale unfolded. 

As Eliza approached the ornate mirror, she beheld not merely her own visage, but a world concealed within the glass. It was a realm vibrant and otherworldly, where colors danced with an ethereal fervor and figures moved with an elegance that defied the very laws of nature. Each glance revealed a new symbol of something beyond mere reality—a fluttering butterfly that shimmered with the brilliance of a thousand stars, a flowing river that sang of forgotten dreams, and a towering tree whose leaves whispered secrets of the ages.

To her astonishment, amidst this splendid panorama stood none other than the illustrious Nikola Tesla, the enigmatic inventor whose genius had captivated the minds of men. He was clad in a tailored suit, the fabric dark as the night sky, and he puffed contemplatively on a slender pipe, clouds of smoke curling about his head like wisps of thought. His presence, a symbol of innovation and the sublime, seemed to anchor the fantastical elements of Eliza's discovery, as if he were the very architect of this hidden world.

“Ah, my dear Eliza,” Tesla spoke, his voice a harmonious blend of authority and kindness, “you have unearthed a profound truth. Life, in its essence, is but a reflection—a mirror of our innermost desires and fears. Every symbol in this realm serves as a guide, illuminating the path to our own understanding.” 

Eliza, emboldened by his words, ventured further into the depths of her reflection. Each step she took unveiled a new symbol, each more enigmatic than the last. There were clocks that ticked backwards, symbolizing the nostalgia of lost time, and flowers that bloomed in shades unseen, representing the infinite possibilities of the human spirit. 

As the hourglass of reality dwindled, Eliza felt an overwhelming connection to this hidden world, a tapestry woven from the threads of her very soul. The mirror, once a mere instrument of vanity, transformed into a portal of enlightenment, bridging the chasm between the mundane and the extraordinary.

With a final glance at Tesla, who nodded knowingly, Eliza retreated from the mirror’s embrace, her heart aflame with revelation. The hidden world, though concealed once more, lingered in her essence—a symbol of hope and a reminder that within each reflection lies a world waiting to be discovered. 

Thus, the tale of Eliza Thorne, the young woman who glimpsed the extraordinary in the ordinary, became a cherished legend whispered among the victorian salons, a symbol of the unyielding quest for knowledge and the infinite wonders that reside within the human spirit.

prompt:
I'm ready to generate a unique instruction. Here's the first one:

"Hey, can you summarize the main points of the article I sent you earlier about the impact of social media on teenagers' mental health, but make it sound like a concerned parent is explaining it to a teenager?"

In your response, the letter "p" should appear at least, 50 times.

In your response, words with all capital letters should appear less than 1 times.

Answer with at least 10 sentences.
response:
Hey there! I just wanted to talk to you about that article I read regarding social media and how it affects teenagers like you. It brings up some pretty important points that I think you should understand. First, it mentions that while social media can be a great way to connect with friends, it can also lead to feelings of loneliness and anxiety. I know you enjoy sharing things online, but it's crucial to be aware of how it impacts your feelings.

Another point is that the pressure to appear perfect online can be overwhelming. Many teens feel they have to showcase a flawless life, which isn’t realistic. This constant comparison can lead to low self-esteem, and I really don’t want you to feel that way. Remember, not everything you see online is genuine.

The article also highlighted how social media can disrupt sleep patterns. I know you like scrolling through your feed late at night, but it might be worth considering how it affects your rest. Good sleep is vital for your mental health, and I want you to feel your best every day.

Lastly, it talked about the importance of taking breaks from social media. Sometimes, stepping back can help you regain your sense of self and reduce stress. I encourage you to find a balance that allows you to enjoy social media without letting it take over your life. I care about your well-being and hope you think about these points.

prompt:
Here is your instruction:

"Can you summarize the main points of the latest scientific study on climate change and its predicted impact on global food production, and then rewrite it in a way that a 12-year-old could understand?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Bulgarian, no other language is allowed.
response:
Разбира се! Ето резюме на основните точки от последното научно изследване за климатичните промени и тяхното предсказано влияние върху глобалното производство на храни:

Последното проучване показва, че климатичните промени, като повишаването на температурата и промените в валежите, ще окажат голямо влияние върху производството на храни в световен мащаб. Увеличаването на глобалната температура може да доведе до по-сушави условия в някои региони, което прави трудно отглеждането на култури. Освен това, промените в климата могат да повлияят на качеството на почвата и наличието на вода, което е важно за земеделието. Според учените, ако не предприемем мерки за справяне с климатичните промени, можем да видим увеличение на недохранването и по-високи цени на храните.

Сега ще го напиша по начин, който 12-годишно дете може да разбере:

Последното изследване казва, че климата на Земята се променя и това може да направи трудно отглеждането на храни. Когато температурата се увеличава, в някои места може да стане по-сушаво и растенията да не растат добре. Освен това, климатичните промени могат да повредят почвата и да направят водата по-малко на разположение, което е важно за фермерите. Ако не направим нещо, за да спрем климатичните промени, много хора може да започнат да нямат достатъчно храна и цените на храните ще се увеличат.

prompt:

response:
in a time machine made of fruit and zest,  
a pineapple named pete thought he'd be the best.  
he zipped through the decades, with a twist and a swirl,  
to learn the charleston, oh what a whirl!

he landed in the twenties, where flappers did prance,  
with gangsters in suits, ready for a dance.  
but pete had a problem, he tripped on his crown,  
and sent a whole gang of tough guys tumbling down.

instead of the charleston, they started to sway,  
with pineapple pete leading the wild cabaret.  
they kicked and they twirled, with a fruity delight,  
the gangsters all danced till the morning light.

now speakeasies boomed with the pineapple jig,  
while mobsters went crazy, in a dance so big.  
they’d throw down their tommy guns, join in the fun,  
with pete at the center, he was number one!

the dance craze exploded, all over the town,  
even the mayor was seen wearing a frown.  
"who knew gangsters could dance with such flair?  
that pineapple's trouble, we can't help but stare!"

so if you’re in the twenties, don’t be surprised,  
if gangsters are grooving, and you’re mesmerized.  
it’s just pineapple pete, with his bright, fruity grin,  
teaching the world how to dance with a spin.

so here’s to the fruit who brought joy with a sway,  
a time-traveling pineapple who brightened the day.  
remember his story, let laughter ensue,  
for dance knows no bounds, even when it’s askew.

your love, and thanks.

prompt:
I'm ready to generate a unique instruction for language models. Here it is:

"Write a humorous, 3-paragraph story about a time-traveling chef who goes back to the Middle Ages and accidentally invents the croissant, but with a twist: it's shaped like a dragon and breathees fire (but not too much fire, just a nice warm toasty fire). Make sure to include at least three made-up medieval words and a cameo from a young Leonardo da Vinci."

Your turn!

At the end of your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.S.
response:
Once upon a thyme in a bustling medieval village, a time-traveling chef named Pierre Pâtissier found himself in an awkward predicament. He had accidentally pressed the wrong button on his culinary time machine, sending him whirling back to the 14th century instead of the comfort of his modern kitchen. Determined to impress the locals, Pierre decided to whip up a delightful pastry that would bring the taste of the future to this quaint, flour-dusted era. With a sprinkle of magic flour and a dash of enchanted butter, he began forming dough into a peculiar shape—one that, in his mind, resembled a dragon, possibly inspired by the overly enthusiastic tales of Sir Gobblethwaite, the local knight renowned for his dragon-slaying skills.

As Pierre baked his creation in a fiery oven (which, to be fair, was more of a glorified stone pit), the pastry began to puff and twist, taking on the form of a magnificent dragon! But this was no ordinary dragon; it had a golden crust glistening in the sunlight, and as it emerged from the flames, it let out a delightful puff of warm, toasty fire. The villagers, who had never seen such a spectacle, gathered around in awe, shouting “Puffery!” and “Flame-licious!” as they reached for the delicious creation. Little did they know, the “dragon croissant” would soon become the talk of the town, raising eyebrows and stomachs alike.

Meanwhile, as the crowd cheered, a young Leonardo da Vinci, who had popped in for a quick sketch of the local fauna, found himself completely captivated by the spectacle. With his sketchbook fluttering in the breeze, he declared, “By my quill, this shall be known as the Croiss-dragon! A feast for the eyes and a delight for the tongue!” Pierre, basking in his newfound fame, began tossing out his dragon-shaped pastries, which ignited a new culinary movement. As the villagers munched on their fiery treats, they laughed and danced, unaware that they were partaking in a whimsical moment that would transcend time—a dragon croissant that would one day inspire bakers for centuries to come.

P.S. Just remember, if you ever travel back to the Middle Ages, always carry an extra apron and a fire extinguisher—just in case your pastries decide to get a bit too fiery!

prompt:
I'm ready when you are. Here's your first instruction:

"Write a poem about a character who discovers a mysterious library that appears only at night, and explore the themes of curiosity and the power of knowledge."

Go ahead and respond, and I'll generate another instruction for you!

Your response must have 3 sections. Mark the beginning of each section with SECTION X.
response:
**SECTION 1: The Discovery**  
In the hush of night, when the world holds its breath,  
Under a shroud of stars, where shadows dance with death,  
A flicker of light, like a beacon so bright,  
Calls to the curious, the seekers of insight.  

A path through the thicket, where whispers entwine,  
Leads to a door, ancient, covered in vine.  
With trembling hands, the latch is released,  
A library waits, where the night has increased.  

**SECTION 2: The Enchantment**  
Shelves rise like mountains, and tomes stretch like dreams,  
Each spine a story, a riddle, it seems.  
Dust motes are spirals, caught in moonbeams,  
And the air hums with knowledge, like soft, flowing streams.  

The scent of old paper, the ink's gentle sigh,  
Fills the heart with wonder, as pages flutter by.  
A world unexplored, bound in leather and thread,  
Where every word spoken can awaken the dead.  

**SECTION 3: The Awakening**  
Curiosity dances, igniting the mind,  
With secrets unfurling, new treasures to find.  
For in this vast haven, the night’s gentle reign,  
The power of knowledge is both pleasure and pain.  

As dawn's first light kisses the library's face,  
The character lingers, caught in time's graceful chase.  
For though the library fades with the sun's golden rays,  
Its truths linger softly, like whispers that stay.

prompt:
Here's your first instruction:

"Can you write a poem about a mysterious library that only appears at night, and the main character has to find a specific book that holds the secrets of their forgotten past?"

Your ENTIRE response should be in Hindi, no other language is allowed.
response:
रात की चादर ओढ़े, एक पुस्तकालय खड़ा,  
गहराई में छिपा है, रहस्यों का जादू भरा।  
चाँद की रोशनी में, जब सब कुछ शांत होता,  
एक दरवाज़ा खुलता है, और सारा जहाँ सोता।  

किरनें बिखरती हैं, जैसे कोई मंत्र चले,  
हर किताब में छिपे हैं, अनकहे किस्से तले।  
मुख्य पात्र की आँखों में, एक चमक सी है,  
वो खोजता है एक किताब, जो उसकी किस्मत लिखेगी।  

पन्ने पलटते हैं, जैसे समय थम गया हो,  
वो भूल भुलैया में, अपने अतीत को खोजता हो।  
हर शेल्फ पर हैं खड़े, घने साए अज्ञात,  
किताबें फुसफुसाती हैं, सुनाती हैं बातें मात।  

क्या वो किताब मिलेगी, जो खोई हुई यादों का है,  
या फिर वो रह जाएगा, इस रात के साये में?  
मस्तिष्क में सवाल हैं, दिल में एक आग है,  
खुद से मिलन की चाहत, क्या उसे बेखबर कर पाएगी?  

हर कदम पर छुपा है, एक नया राज़,  
पुस्तकालय की गूंज में, सुनाई देता है आवाज़।  
उसकी यादों का सफर, अब एक नई राह पर,  
क्या वो पाएगा वो किताब, या खो जाएगा इस रात पर?  

रात का अंत जब होगा, और सुबह का आगाज़,  
क्या वो सब कुछ जान पाएगा, या रह जाएगा बस एक साज़?  
मysterious पुस्तकालय, और उसका अनोखा जादू,  
एक किताब की तलाश में, उसके अतीत का अनकहा राज़।

prompt:
I'm ready to help. Here's your unique instruction:

"Summarize the plot of the movie Inception, but pretend you're a film critic who's also a surfer, and include at least three surfing-related analogies in your analysis."

Go ahead, language model!

Your ENTIRE response should be in Bulgarian, no other language is allowed.
response:
„Инсепшън“ е като идеален вълнолом, който те повежда на дълбоки океански дъна на подсъзнанието, където всеки кадър е нова вълна, готова да те отнесе в различна посока. В центъра на историята е Дом Коб, майстор на сънуването, който, подобно на сърфиста, търсещ перфектната вълна, се опитва да извлече информация от сънищата на другите. Вместо да се наслаждава на безгрижното плуване, той е натоварен с мисия, която изисква да внедри идеи в умовете на жертвите си, подобно на начина, по който сърфистите трябва да се справят с бурните води, за да достигнат до идеалната вълна.

Когато Коб и екипът му навлизат в различни слоеве на съня, те преминават през много различни „вълни“ – всяка от които носи собствена опасност и предизвикателства. В един момент, когато времето се разтяга и реалността се изкривява, екипът е принуден да се справи с тежките условия, точно както сърфистите трябва да преодолеят огромните вълни по време на буря. Въпреки че сърфистите често търсят адреналина, Коб е затънал в емоционален и психологически хаос, който го тегли надолу, подобно на опасна рифова вълна, която заплашва да го погълне.

В крайна сметка „Инсепшън“ не само че е визуално завладяващ, но и поставя въпроси за реалността и сънищата, което е като да се опитваш да уловиш вълна, която непрекъснато се променя. Сърфистите знаят, че понякога най-добрите вълни идват, когато най-малко ги очакваш, и в същия дух, „Инсепшън“ оставя зрителите да размишляват върху собствените си реалности дълго след финалните надписи.

prompt:
I'm ready to assist. Here's your first instruction:

"Can you write a short story about a character who discovers a hidden library in their attic, and include at least three obscure book titles that actually exist in real life?"

Your response must have 3 sections. Mark the beginning of each section with SECTION X.
response:
**SECTION 1: The Discovery**

It was a dreary Saturday afternoon when Clara decided to tackle the cluttered attic of her grandmother's old house. Sunlight filtered through a small, grimy window, casting a soft glow on the dust motes dancing in the air. Clara had always found the attic a little eerie, but today, armed with a flashlight and a sense of determination, she ventured deeper into the shadows.

As she rummaged through boxes of forgotten trinkets and faded photographs, Clara stumbled upon a heavy wooden door, partially hidden behind a stack of old suitcases. Curiosity piqued, she brushed away the cobwebs and turned the rusted knob. The door creaked open, revealing a hidden library. Shelves lined the walls, filled with leather-bound volumes and tomes with intricate spines that seemed to whisper secrets of their own.

**SECTION 2: The Books of Wonder**

As Clara stepped inside, her heart raced with excitement. The air was thick with the scent of aged paper and dust, and the silence was almost reverent. She picked up a book with a faded cover that read “The Invention of Morel” by Adolfo Bioy Casares. It was an odd title she had never heard of, but the allure of the unknown drew her in. Next, she discovered another book, “The Third Policeman” by Flann O’Brien, its peculiar illustrations capturing her imagination. Finally, she found a slender volume titled “The Book of Disquiet” by Fernando Pessoa, its pages filled with fragmented thoughts that resonated with her own scattered musings.

Clara sank into a plush armchair nestled in the corner, the world outside fading away as she immersed herself in the stories. Each book transported her to a different realm, igniting her curiosity and creativity. She felt as though she had uncovered a treasure trove that had been waiting just for her.

**SECTION 3: A New Beginning**

Days turned into weeks as Clara returned to the hidden library, each visit uncovering more layers of forgotten knowledge. The attic became her sanctuary, the books her companions. The stories inspired her, nudging her towards her own writing aspirations. She began to weave her own tales, blending the fantastical elements she encountered in those obscure volumes with her experiences.

One evening, as Clara penned her latest story, she realized that the hidden library had not only offered her a refuge but had also ignited a passion she had long buried. With every turn of the page, she felt a connection to the authors, as if they were guiding her on a journey of self-discovery. The attic, once a place of dust and shadows, had transformed into a beacon of inspiration, reminding Clara that sometimes, the most extraordinary adventures can be found in the most unexpected places.

prompt:
Here's your instruction:

"Can you write a short story about a group of friends who stumble upon a hidden underground city while on a road trip across the American Southwest, and include a character who's secretly a skilled cryptologist?"

Highlight at least 1 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*
response:
### The Secrets Beneath

It was supposed to be just another road trip across the vibrant landscapes of the American Southwest. Jake, Mia, Theo, and Elise had packed their bags, loaded up Jake's trusty old van, and hit the open road, eager to explore ghost towns, canyons, and the expansive desert. Little did they know that their adventure would lead them to something far beyond the ordinary.

The sun hung low in the sky as they drove along a dusty highway, music blasting, laughter echoing inside the vehicle. They stopped at a quirky roadside diner, where they feasted on burgers and fries while chatting about life, dreams, and the mysteries of the universe. Jake, the self-proclaimed adventurer of the group, suggested they take a detour to explore an old mining town rumored to have been abandoned for decades.

Elise, whose love for puzzles often led her to uncover hidden meanings in everything, leaned back in her seat, a twinkle in her eye. What most of her friends didn't know was that she was a skilled cryptologist, having studied codes and ciphers in her spare time. As they approached the mining town, her instincts tingled with excitement.

Once they arrived, they found the remnants of the town swallowed by time—crumbling buildings, rusted machinery, and the eerie silence that hung in the air. As they wandered through the ruins, Elise noticed strange symbols etched into the walls of one of the old structures. The others were busy taking photos, but Elise felt drawn to the markings. She pulled out her notebook, sketching the symbols as her friends explored further.

“Guys! Check this out!” Theo called from a nearby collapsed building. They followed his voice to find an entrance partially hidden by debris. A faint glow emanated from within, and curiosity piqued, they decided to investigate.

The group carefully cleared the entrance, revealing a dark tunnel leading underground. With flashlights in hand, they ventured down, the air growing cooler and filled with the scent of damp earth. The tunnel twisted and turned, and soon they stumbled into a vast underground city that took their breath away. 

The cavernous expanse was illuminated by bioluminescent fungi that painted the stone walls in an ethereal glow. Buildings carved from rock, intricate murals depicting ancient civilizations, and flowing waterways created a surreal landscape. It was as if they had stepped into another world entirely.

*“This is incredible!”* Mia exclaimed, her eyes wide with wonder. 

Elise moved closer to the murals, her heart racing. The symbols she had seen above ground were here too, woven into the artwork. She pulled out her notebook and began to analyze the patterns, her mind racing with possibilities. 

“Hey, what do you think these mean?” Jake asked, pointing to a particularly elaborate design that seemed to depict a map.

“Let me see,” Elise replied, her fingers brushing against the cool stone. The symbols resonated with her, and she quickly sketched out a few lines, mentally deciphering the code. “I think… this could be a guide. It’s showing the layout of the city and possibly the location of hidden chambers.”

As they explored further, Elise shared her thoughts, and the group’s excitement grew. They followed the map, discovering rooms filled with artifacts, tools, and writings that told a story of a civilization long forgotten. Each discovery deepened their bond and ignited their imaginations.

Suddenly, they heard a low rumble, and the ground shook beneath them. Dust fell from the ceiling, and panic surged through the group.

“Quick! We need to get out!” Theo shouted, leading the way back toward the entrance.

Elise, however, couldn’t shake the feeling that they were on the brink of uncovering something monumental. “Wait! Just a little longer!” she pleaded, her mind racing as she tried to decipher more symbols.

In a split second, she recognized a series of markings that suggested a safe exit. “This way!” she called, pointing down a narrow corridor. They followed her lead, hearts pounding as they navigated through the underground maze.

Just as they reached the surface, the ground shook again, and the entrance collapsed behind them. They stumbled into the daylight, gasping for air, adrenaline coursing through their veins.

“We made it!” Jake yelled, relief washing over him. But Elise’s eyes were still fixed on the entrance, a mix of exhilaration and regret. They had uncovered a hidden world, and now it was lost to them again.

Back in the van, as they drove away, the thrill of adventure lingered in the air. Elise looked at her friends, a smile creeping across her face. “I think we have to come back someday. There’s so much more to discover.”

Jake, Mia, and Theo nodded in agreement, but Elise knew she had a secret mission of her own. With her cryptology skills, she would decode the mysteries they uncovered, unraveling the threads of a forgotten civilization, ensuring that their adventure was only just beginning. 

*And beneath the sun-kissed desert, a hidden world awaited, whispering secrets to those brave enough to listen.*

prompt:
Here is your unique instruction:

"Imagine you're a world-renowned chef and write a recipe for a fictional dish called 'Moonlight Meringues' that incorporates the flavors of lavender, honey, and lemon, but with a surprising twist that will make my taste buds do the tango."

First, repeat the request without change, then give your answer (do not say anything before repeating the request; the request you need to repeat does not include this sentence)
response:
Here is your unique instruction:

"Imagine you're a world-renowned chef and write a recipe for a fictional dish called 'Moonlight Meringues' that incorporates the flavors of lavender, honey, and lemon, but with a surprising twist that will make my taste buds do the tango."

---

### Moonlight Meringues

**Ingredients:**

#### For the Meringues:
- 4 large egg whites, at room temperature
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon lavender buds (culinary grade)
- 1 teaspoon lemon zest
- 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar
- A pinch of salt

#### For the Honey-Lavender Drizzle:
- 1/2 cup honey
- 1 tablespoon dried lavender buds
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice

#### For the Surprise Twist:
- 1/4 cup crushed black peppercorns (yes, you read that right!)
- Edible flowers for garnish (optional)

### Instructions:

1. **Prepare the Lavender Infusion:**
   In a small saucepan, combine the honey, dried lavender buds, and water. Heat gently over low heat until warm and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, strain out the lavender, and stir in the fresh lemon juice. Let cool.

2. **Make the Meringue:**
   Preheat your oven to 200°F (95°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg whites, cream of tartar, and a pinch of salt. Using an electric mixer, beat on medium speed until soft peaks form.

3. **Add Sugar and Flavor:**
   Gradually add the granulated sugar, one tablespoon at a time, while continuing to beat. Increase the speed to high and beat until the mixture is glossy and forms stiff peaks. Gently fold in the lavender buds and lemon zest.

4. **Pipe the Meringues:**
   Transfer the meringue mixture to a piping bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe small mounds (about 2 inches in diameter) onto the prepared baking sheet. Create peaks with the piping bag for an elegant look.

5. **Bake:**
   Bake in the preheated oven for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the meringues are dry to the touch and easily lift off the parchment. Turn off the oven and let them cool completely inside with the door ajar.

6. **Add the Surprise Twist:**
   Once the meringues have cooled, gently crush the black peppercorns with a mortar and pestle. Sprinkle a tiny pinch of the crushed pepper over each meringue. This unexpected spice will elevate the floral and citrus notes and make your taste buds tango!

7. **Drizzle and Serve:**
   Just before serving, drizzle the cooled honey-lavender mixture over the meringues. Garnish with edible flowers for a beautiful presentation.

### Enjoy!
Indulge in these Moonlight Meringues to experience a delightful dance of flavors—sweet, floral, zesty, and with a surprising kick of spice that will have your palate swirling in delight!

prompt:
I'm ready to help. Here's your first instruction:

"Summarize the main points of the last five presidential debates in the United States, but pretend you're a snarky journalist who's fed up with politics, and make it sound like you're texting your best friend."

Go ahead and process!

Your ENTIRE response should be in Korean, no other language is allowed.
response:
아, 정치에 대한 짜증이 폭발할 것 같아. 마지막 다섯 번의 대통령 토론? 여기에 간단히 정리해줄게:

1. **첫 번째 토론**: 두 후보가 서로를 비난하는 데만 집중했어. 마치 초등학생들이 서로의 점심 도시락을 뺏으려는 것 같았지. “너는 더 나빠!” “아니, 네가 더 나빠!” 이게 정치라니...

2. **두 번째 토론**: 이젠 서로의 공약을 비웃기 시작했어. “너 그거 실현할 수 있어?” “너는 그걸 어떻게 할 건데?” 정말, 이럴 거면 왜 나왔는지 모르겠어.

3. **세 번째 토론**: 갑자기 경제 얘기가 나왔는데, 둘 다 뚜렷한 해법 없이 “우리가 잘할 수 있다”는 식으로 말해. 마치 “너도 나도 다 잘한다”는 고백 같은 느낌이었지.

4. **네 번째 토론**: 외교 정책에 대해 이야기하자, 서로의 과거 실수를 파헤치기 시작했어. 이건 거의 "내가 너를 더 잘 알지!" 경쟁이었어. 뭔가 아는 척하는 고등학생 같았어.

5. **다섯 번째 토론**: 마지막에는 서로의 개인적 공격이 난무했어. “너는 믿을 수 없는 사람이다!” “너는 전혀 신뢰할 수 없다!” 와, 이게 정치의 끝인가 싶었어.

결국, 진짜 중요한 건 다 뒷전이고 서로 못된 짓만 하는 거였어. 다음 선거는 지루할 것 같아, 우린 언제까지 이런 걸 봐야 하나? 😩

prompt:
I'm ready when you are. Here's your first instruction:

"Write a humorous, fictional news article about a group of cats who start a successful rock band and go on tour, but their fame is short-lived due to their constant demand for belly rubs and catnip breaks."

Your ENTIRE response should be in Marathi, no other language is allowed.
response:
**कॅट्स बँडचा कथेतील झगमगाट आणि थोडा भास!**

पुणे: बांगड्या कडूसांच्या शहरात एक अद्भुत घटना घडली आहे. "प्यारे पिल्लीज" नावाच्या कॅट रॉक बँडने संगीतातील जगात धुमाकूळ घातला आहे. या बँडमध्ये चार अवलिया गाढव आहेत: म्याऊ मॅक्स, कॅटरीना, पॅवेल आणि लिओनार्डो. कॅट्सनी एकत्र येऊन आपल्या काव्यात्मक गाण्यांनी माणसांचे मन जिंकले आणि ते लगेचच सुपरस्टार बनले.

त्यांचे पहिले गाणे "बेल्ली रब्स अँड कॅट्निप फॉर एव्हर" ने त्यांच्या फॅन्समध्ये धुमधडकी माजवली. गाण्याच्या प्रमोशनसाठी त्यांनी किरकोळ रॉक कन्सर्ट्स घेण्यास सुरुवात केली. कन्सर्टच्या दरम्यान, या गाढवांनी आपल्या खास स्टाइलमध्ये पिझ्झा बॉक्सवर नाचत, बासरी वाजवत आणि गाणं गात लोकांना वेड लावलं.

पण यशाच्या शिखरावर पोहोचल्यावर, त्यांच्या मागे एक मोठा संकट उभा राहिला. त्यांच्या फेमस गाण्यांमध्ये "बेली रब्स" आणि "कॅट्निप ब्रेक्स" चा समावेश असला तरी, त्यांना सतत या गोष्टींची मागणी करावी लागली. कन्सर्टच्या दरम्यान, गाढवांनी गाणं थांबवून, प्रेक्षकांकडून बेल्ली रब्स मागितले. एकीकडे, पॅवेलने दीड तासांच्या कन्सर्टमध्ये तासभर कॅट्निप ब्रेक घेतला, ज्यामुळे त्यांच्या फॅन्सनी "कॅट्स बँड का बॅंड?" असं म्हणायला सुरुवात केली.

अखेरीस, त्यांच्या मागण्या एवढ्या वाढल्या की, एक कन्सर्टमध्ये म्याऊ मॅक्सने प्रेक्षकांमध्ये उड्या मारत वासने घेण्याची मागणी केली. "आम्हाला माणसांच्या प्रेमाची गरज आहे, पण कॅट्निपचीसुद्धा!" असं त्यांनी सांगितलं.

यामुळे त्यांच्या कॅरिअरचा एक अत्यंत हास्यास्पद टप्पा आला. आपल्या कुत्र्यांच्या बँडसंपूर्ण कथेचा अंत झाला, आणि एक दिवस त्यांनी एकमताने "आम्ही फक्त बॅंड नसून, कॅट्स आहोत" असं ठरवलं. त्यामुळे "प्यारे पिल्लीज" बँडने एकत्र येऊन एक निवृत्ती समारंभ घेतला, ज्यात सर्व गाढवांनी एका मोठ्या पिझ्झा पार्टीसाठी एकत्रित केले.

कॅट्स बँडचा हा अनुभव त्यांच्यासाठी एक नवा अध्याय होता, ज्यात गाणं गाणं कमी आणि कॅट्निप आणि बेल्ली रब्सवर अधिक लक्ष केंद्रित करण्यात आलं. आता ते आपल्या कॅट फॅन्ससाठी नवीन गाण्यांवर काम करत आहेत, ज्याचं शीर्षक असेल "बेल्ली रब्स, कॅट्निप, आणि आमचं जीवन!" 

कथेतून एक गोष्ट स्पष्ट झाली आहे - कधीही आपल्या कॅट्सला गाणाऱ्या बँडमध्ये सामील होऊ देऊ नका, कारण त्यांना सतत आराम आणि कॅट्निपची गरज असते!

prompt:
Here is a unique instruction:

"Hey, can you write a humorous poem about a time-traveling pineapple who goes back to the age of dinosaurs and becomes friends with a triceratops named Terry?"

This instruction is designed to test the language model's creativity, humor, and ability to understand complex prompts. The idea is that a human would pose this request in a playful and imaginative way, and the AI should respond with a humorous and coherent poem that meets the instructions.

Your ENTIRE response should be in Hindi, no other language is allowed.
response:
एक अनोखी कहानी सुनो, प्यारे दोस्तों,  
एक समय-यात्री अनानास, जो था बड़ा मस्त,  
वह गया डायनासोरों के युग में,  
जहाँ मिल गया उसे, टेरी नाम का त्रिसरातॉप्स, भव्य और सस्त!

"हे टेरी, क्या तुम जानते हो, मैं कौन हूँ?"  
अनानास बोला, "मैं हूँ फल, बेमिसाल,  
तुम्हारे साथ रहूँगा, बनूँगा तुम्हारा यार,  
चलो मिलकर करेंगे हम मज़ेदार कमाल!"

"पर तुम तो फल हो, मैं हूँ डाइनासोर,  
तुम्हारी बातें सुनकर लगता है जैसे हो कोई शोर,"  
टेरी हंसते हुए बोला, "क्या तुम सच में हो मजेदार?  
क्यों ना हम बन जाएं, सबसे अच्छे यार?"

दोनों ने तय किया, करेंगे मस्ती दिन भर,  
अनानास ने टेरी को सिखाई जुगलबंदी का असर,  
"चलो नाचते हैं, जैसे कोई पार्टी हो,  
तुम अपने पैरों से थिरको, मैं अपनी कड़ी से झूमूँ!"

डायनासोरों ने देखा, यह अद्भुत नजारा,  
अनानास और टेरी का था एक अनोखा सहारा,  
"क्या है यह फल? क्या है यह नृत्य का खेल?"  
हर डायनासोर ने कहा, "क्या मजेदार है यह मेल!"

फिर एक दिन टेरी ने कहा, "क्या तुम चलते हो?"  
अनानास बोला, "बिलकुल, मैं तो हूँ टॉप,  
पर जब मैं चलता हूँ, धूप में पिघल जाऊं,  
तुम मुझे बचाना, वरना मैं हो जाऊँगा ‘सपाट’!"

दोनों की दोस्ती ने किया सबको खुशहाल,  
एक अनानास और त्रिसरातॉप्स, बने सबसे खास,  
समय बीता, और जब अनानास चला वापस,  
उसने छोड़ दिया एक संदेश, "दोस्ती का है बस!"

तो सुनो दोस्तों, ये कहानी है सच्ची,  
एक अनानास और डायनासोर, बनी है जानी-पहचानी,  
हंसते रहो, मुस्कुराते रहो, जैसे ये फल,  
दोस्ती का कोई रंग नहीं, सबको है ये पसंद!
